name: Superior temporal sulcus
description: auditory processing, including language, but also has been implicated as a critical structure in social cognition

name: Anterior cingulate cortex
description: several complex cognitive functions, such as empathy, impulse control, emotion, and decision-making.

name: Middle frontal gyrus
description: the dominant (left) middle frontal gyrus plays a key role in the development of literacy, while the nondominant (right) middle frontal gyrus is responsible for numeracy.

name: Cuneus
description: a structure in the visual cortex that plays an important role in the identification and recognition of words.

name: Entorhinal cortex
description: the gateway for information entering and leaving the hippocampal formation.

name: Frontal pole
description: the function of frontal pole neurons is to monitor action outcomes.

name: Fusiform gyrus
description: plays important roles in object and face recognition, and recognition of facial expressions

name: Inferior parietal lobule
description: concerned with language, mathematical operations, and body image, particularly the supramarginal gyrus and the angular gyrus.

name: Inferior temporal gyrus
description: crucial for visual object recognition and is considered to be the final stage in the ventral cortical visual system.

name: Insular cortex
description: plays a role in a variety of homeostatic functions related to basic survival needs, such as taste, visceral sensation, and autonomic control.

name: Isthmus of cingulate gyrus
description: an integral part of the limbic system, which is involved with emotion formation and processing, learning, and memory.

name: Lateral occipital sulcus
description: divides the lateral, or middle occipital gyrus into a superior and an inferior part, which are then continuous in front with the parietal and temporal lobes.

name: Lateral orbitofrontal cortex
description: non-reward and punishment.

name: Lingual gyrus
description: linked to processing vision, especially related to letters.

name: Medial orbitofrontal cortex
description: represents emotion and reward in decision making.

name: Middle temporal gyrus
description: involved in a number of cognitive processes, including semantic memory processing, language processes, and integrating information from different senses.

name: Paracentral lobule
description: controls motor and sensory innervations of the contralateral lower extremity. It is also responsible for control of defecation and urination.

name: Parahippocampal gyrus
description: plays an important role in memory encoding and retrieval.

name: Pars opercularis
description: involved in language production and phonological processing due to its connections with motor areas of the mouth and tongue.

name: Pars orbitalis
description: plays a role in the language processing network of the brain.

name: Pars triangularis
description: most commonly associated with Broca's area and is well known in its involvement in speech production.

name: Pericalcarine cortex
description: vision.

name: Postcentral gyrus
description: processes sensory information such as touch and information about where the body is and which direction it is moving.

name: Posterior cingulate cortex
description: highly connected and one of the most metabolically active regions in the brain, but there is no consensus as to its cognitive role.

name: Precentral gyrus
description: known as the motor strip or primary motor cortex, is the part of the brain's neocortex responsible for executing voluntary movements.

name: Precuneus
description: involved with episodic memory, visuospatial processing, reflections upon self, and aspects of consciousness.

name: Rostral anterior cingulate cortex
description: ideally positioned between limbic and cortical structures to integrate emotion and cognition and is thereby primed to influence amygdala-dependent learning.

name: Rostral Middle Frontal Gyrus
description: Uncertain.

name: Superior frontal gyrus
description: contributes to higher cognitive functions and particularly to working memory (WM), although the nature of its involvement remains a matter of debate.

name: Superior parietal lobe
description: involved with spatial orientation, and receives a great deal of visual input as well as sensory input from one's hand.

name: Superior temporal gyrus
description: involved in auditory processing, including language, but also has been implicated as a critical structure in social cognition.

name: Supramarginal gyrus
description: plays a role in phonological processing (i.e. of spoken and written language) and emotional responses.

name: Temporal pole
description: has some role in both social and emotional processes, including face recognition and theory of mind, that goes beyond semantic memory.

name: Transverse temporal gyrus
description: the first cortical structures to process incoming auditory information.

name: Unknown
description: oh what's this?
